response_text:
<![CDATA[CBC | Politics News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/politics/?cmp=rss en-ca Thu, 12 May 2016 22:14:35 EDT CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[Liberal pursuit of electoral reform off to a difficult start]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/wherry-liberals-electoral-reform-1.3579651?cmp=rss 1.3579651 Thu, 12 May 2016 20:06:11 EDT Aaron Wherry News/Politics

If one measures the quality of a democracy by the amount of noise it generates, this was indisputably a good day for Canadian democracy. But otherwise, the amount of fuming and howling suggested some amount of disagreement with Maryam Monsef's assessment that yesterday was not just a good day, but a "great day" for democracy.

]]> <![CDATA[Sophie Grégoire-Trudeau's claim of being overwhelmed sparks debate about role of PM's spouse]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/sophie-gregoire-trudeau-overwhelmed-1.3580164?cmp=rss 1.3580164 Thu, 12 May 2016 20:45:51 EDT Peter Zimonjic News/Politics

Sophie Grégoire-Trudeau’s claim that she's overwhelmed and needs more staff to cope with the mountain of requests for her time has ignited a debate about the role of the prime minister’s wife.

]]> <![CDATA[Liberals follow Tory lead in stalling sanctions over killing of Russian whistleblower]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/liberals-foot-drag-russia-1.3579347?cmp=rss 1.3579347 Thu, 12 May 2016 21:21:30 EDT Terry Milewski News/Politics

For six years, Bill Browder has campaigned for sanctions on Russian officials who allegedly engineered a massive theft and the murder of Browder's Moscow lawyer. The U.S. said yes to Browder. The EU agreed. The Canadians — whether Liberal or Conservative — keep promising, but don't deliver.

]]> <![CDATA['I've loved Quebec ever since': Bill Morneau brings up dating Monique Jérôme-Forget's daughter]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/bill-morneau-jokes-quebec-1.3580376?cmp=rss 1.3580376 Thu, 12 May 2016 22:14:35 EDT The Canadian Press News/Canada/Montreal

Bill Morneau told Quebec business leaders on Thursday he's always appreciated the province's open and friendly climate — but this time Canada's finance minister wasn't talking about investment.

]]> <![CDATA[Staffing boost underway for privately sponsored Syrian refugees amid complaints]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/mccallum-refugee-mess-sponsors-1.3577626?cmp=rss 1.3577626 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT Susana Mas News/Politics

Immigration Minister John McCallum says additional staff are in Canadian visa offices in the Middle East "as of today" in an effort to finalize more applications for privately sponsored Syrian refugees, as "disarray" and long delays continue to exasperate Canadian sponsors.

]]> <![CDATA[Portrait of PM Paul Martin who ruled from the cheap seats: Neil Macdonald]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/paul-martin-portrait-neil-macdonald-1.3578724?cmp=rss 1.3578724 Thu, 12 May 2016 11:42:17 EDT Neil Macdonald News/Politics

As the portrait of former prime minister Paul Martin goes up on Parliament Hill, Neil Macdonald recalls a politician who was decent and honest and worked harder than just about everybody else.

]]> <![CDATA[Postmedia's Godfrey wants lifeline of tax breaks, bigger government ad spending]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/godfrey-bailout-postmedia-newspaper-1.3579215?cmp=rss 1.3579215 Thu, 12 May 2016 13:32:19 EDT Terry Pedwell News/Politics

The head of one of Canada's biggest media empires is calling on Ottawa to spend more on Canadian newspaper ads, and to give greater tax breaks to companies that do the same.

]]> <![CDATA[The Pollcast: The Liberals' electoral reform gambit]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/grenier-pollcast-wherry-crawford-1.3578965?cmp=rss 1.3578965 Thu, 12 May 2016 14:52:44 EDT CBC News News/Politics

With the Liberals holding a majority of seats on the electoral reform committee, how realistic is it that any reform will have cross-party support? And is there even time to get it done? To try to answer these questions and more, host Éric Grenier is joined by the CBC's Aaron Wherry and Alison Crawford.

]]> <![CDATA[Edmonton, south Saskatchewan and B.C. interior meet criteria for EI extension]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/edmonton-saskatchewan-bc-interior-employment-insurance-extension-1.3579173?cmp=rss 1.3579173 Thu, 12 May 2016 13:13:36 EDT Jordan Press News/Politics

Documents outlining how the federal government chose 12 economic regions for extended EI benefits suggest Edmonton and at least two other areas would now qualify for the same help.

]]> <![CDATA[Liberals announce new rules to limit government advertising]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/brison-government-advertising-rules-1.3578904?cmp=rss 1.3578904 Thu, 12 May 2016 11:33:57 EDT The Canadian Press News/Politics

The federal government will no longer be able to advertise policy measures that have not yet been adopted by Parliament under new rules designed to curb partisanship in taxpayer funded ads.

]]> <![CDATA[Partisan interests difficult to avoid in electoral reform debate]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/grenier-electoral-reform-politics-1.3577086?cmp=rss 1.3577086 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT Éric Grenier News/Politics

Maryam Monsef, minister of democratic institutions, hopes MPs will be able to put political interests aside as they debate changing the way Canadians vote. That seems unlikely, as the electoral impact of reform will be hard to ignore for MPs — including those Liberals dominating the committee studying the issue.

]]> <![CDATA[Polish president wants more Canadian troops to deter Russia's 'expansionist, imperial policy']]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/poland-president-duda-nato-troops-1.3578277?cmp=rss 1.3578277 Wed, 11 May 2016 22:04:46 EDT Jennifer Chevalier News/Politics

Polish President Andrzej Duda is calling on Canada to send more troops to Poland to deter Russian aggression, amid EU concerns about the "danger" posed to Polish democracy by his government.

]]> <![CDATA[Liberal MP Rob Oliphant says he can't support assisted-dying legislation]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/oliphant-assisted-dying-1.3577663?cmp=rss 1.3577663 Wed, 11 May 2016 16:26:45 EDT Aaron Wherry News/Politics

Liberal MP Rob Oliphant, who the government appointed to co-chair a special committee study of medically assisted death, says he cannot support the government's bill to regulate the practice. "I won't be supporting Bill C-14 as it currently stands, even with the minor amendments," Oliphant says.

]]> <![CDATA[Adopting UN Indigenous rights declaration requires reform of Canada's laws: AFN]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/aboriginal/afn-national-chief-declaration-speech-1.3578940?cmp=rss 1.3578940 Thu, 12 May 2016 11:06:22 EDT CBC News News/Aboriginal

The Assembly of First Nations says implementing the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples will require that Canadian laws and policies be reformed.

]]> <![CDATA[Midweek pod: wildfire wake-up call]]> http://www.cbc.ca/radio/thehouse/midweek-pod-wildfire-wake-up-call-1.3577298?cmp=rss 1.3577298 Wed, 11 May 2016 13:23:53 EDT CBC News Radio/The House

You asked, we listened. After a flood of feedback from listeners wanting to hear from scientists on climate change and the link to the Fort McMurray wildfire, we asked two climate change and fire experts to come on the show.

]]>
